name: incitement
content:

the act of encouraging someone to do or feel something unpleasant or violent: [ + to infinitive ] They were imprisoned for incitement to commit grievous bodily harm. There are laws against incitement of racial hatred. See
incite
More examplesFewer examplesThe former leader had often been accused of political incitement.The lawyer said she intended to charge the protesters with incitement to violence.Her article was viewed as a possible incitement to insurrection.
